alert.note: Alert for Southwest Carbon County (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued May 05 at 11:15AM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: .Warm temperatures may melt high mountain snowpack and increase river flows. ...FLOOD WATCH FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of south central Wyoming, including the following area, Southwest Carbon County. * WHEN...Through late tonight. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Area creeks and streams are running high and could flood with more heavy rain. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Warmer temperatures will lead to increasing snow melt. HEavy rainfall also possible as early as WEdnesday afternoon that will continue into Thursday. The Little Snake River at Dixon is already running at or near bankfull at this time. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
